title: Florissant Fossil Beds National Monument: While At The Park - Self Guided
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Education     Plan A Field Trip     Self Guided     While At The Park - Self Guided                  While At The park       Things to do on a visit to Florissant Fossil Beds:  Go to the visitor center and look at the displays of insect and leaf fossils. This is the best place to see these types of fossils. Go on the one-mile Petrified Forest Loop or 1/2 mile Ponderosa Loop. Both trails have interpretive signage. Explore the outdoor exhibit area where you can see massive petrified redwood trees and exhibits on geology and paleontology. Visit the Hornbek Homestead and learn from the exhibits and self-guided booklet. Go on one of our hiking trails and learn about the modern ecosystem. There is also a nearby, privately owned fossil collecting site. For a fee, your class can collect the same kinds of plant and insect fossils that are found in the Florissant Fossil Beds. Call the Monument for details. Have the students complete the Junior Ranger Program.
